questions.question: Everybody was there …………………………… Samuel.
questions.description: But can mean except after all, every, none, any or no.

questions.question: ………………………….. the storm, we would have been home before evening.
questions.description: But for can mean if something had not existed or happened. Except for is not used with this meaning.

questions.question: Nobody but …………………………… would act so foolishly.
questions.description: We normally use object pronouns after but subject pronouns are possible in a more formal style.

questions.question: We got it out ………………………….. a screwdriver.
questions.description: We use with when we talk about the tool or object we use to get a result.

questions.question: It takes me only about 5 minutes to …………………………. ready.
questions.description: We do not use become to talk about deliberate actions.

questions.question: I couldn’t help …………………………. what they said.
questions.description: We use an ing form after cannot help / could not help.

questions.question: I can’t help but ………………………………. where she has disappeared.
questions.description: After can’t help but we use an infinitive without to.

questions.question: They got married in January, and got divorced six months …………………………
questions.description: Later means at a time in the future or after the time you have mentioned.

questions.question: I will make all your dreams ………………………………… true.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after make.

questions.question: Everything came …………………………… in the end.
questions.description: Come is used in some fixed expressions. Common examples are come true and come right.

questions.question: When did you ………………………….. to live in this town?
questions.description: We use come to talk about movements to the place where the speaker or the hearer is.

questions.question: I want to ……………………….. and live somewhere else.
questions.description: We use go for movements to other places.
